sense.name: process or set of rules that provides order and structure
sense.commentary: does not refer to concrete/physical instantiations of the system (for concrete realizations, see sense 4)
sense.examples: The democratic political system works He tried to understand their system of classification We can't do it unless we establish some system around here. That language has a complex system for indicating gender. the metric system

sense.name: man-made system of (electrical/mechanical) closely interacting parts
biological system of closely interacting parts
sense.examples: The body has a system of organs for digestion respiratory system Exercise helped him get the alcohol out of his system

sense.name: loose collection of concrete objects which are linked through regularized interactions
sense.examples: Our healthcare/rail/transportation/political/social/mail system is in decline due to liberal politicians and the erosion of family values.

sense.name: the powers that be
sense.commentary: Used with NO adjectives and always with the definite determiner ("The System")
sense.examples: they want to overthrow the system. You can't beat the system

sense.name: strong desires and feelings
sense.examples: "John got drinking out of his system" (cf. the similar example in sense 3) I can't seem to get you out of my system...

sense.name: a sample of matter in which substances in different phases are in equilibrium.
sense.examples: in a static system, oil cannot be replaced by water on a surface
